_header: How shall a man in peace abide
_description: W. Hichecoke, ‘This Worlde is but a Vanyte’ — twenty-five couplets

BLAdd11307.First Lines:
How schal a mann best in pes abide?Hy hart and enuy set
                    aside…
BLAdd11307.Last Lines:
…Eche man wel be holde his degreffor this worlde is but a
                    vanyte
BLAdd11307.Attributed Title:
This World is but a Vanity (f. 120); Of three poems copied from another MS
                    (title tage, f. 1, nineteenth-century hand)

HunHM183.First Lines:
How schal a mann best in pes abideHy hart and enuy set
                    aside…
HunHM183.Last Lines:
…Eche man wel beholde his degreffor this worlde is but a
                    vanyte
HunHM183.Note:
Repeated on 4ra and again on 4rb by later
                    hands.
